title: Basic Tactics
description: Learn fundamental tactical patterns: forks, pins, and skewers

lessons.title: Knight Fork
lessons.description: Find the knight move that attacks both the king and rook

alternatives.feedback: This attacks the bishop but misses the better fork opportunity
This move doesn't accomplish much. Look for a move that attacks multiple pieces

lessons.hint: Look for a central square where your knight can attack both the bishop and another piece
lessons.explanation: Nd5 is a powerful fork, attacking both the bishop on c4 and giving check to the king. This forces White to move the king, allowing you to capture the bishop on the next move.

lessons.title: Bishop Pin
lessons.description: Use your bishop to pin the knight to the king

alternatives.feedback: This develops the bishop but doesn't create immediate pressure
Knights can't pin pieces. Try using your bishop instead

lessons.hint: Look for a way to attack the knight while making it difficult to move
lessons.explanation: Bg5 pins the knight on f6 to the black queen, making it difficult for Black to develop normally. If the knight moves, Black loses the queen.

lessons.title: Rook Skewer
lessons.description: Use your rook to skewer the king and queen

alternatives.feedback: This isn't check. Look for a move that forces the king to move
Close! But you can do better by giving check

lessons.hint: Give check with your rook on the back rank
lessons.explanation: Ra8+ is a devastating skewer! The black king must move, and then you can capture the rook on a8 with Rxa8, winning material.

lessons.title: Discovered Attack
lessons.description: Move your knight to unleash a discovered attack

alternatives.feedback: This moves the knight but doesn't create a strong discovered attack
The knight blocks your own pawn. Try a different square

lessons.hint: Move your knight to attack f7 while uncovering an attack on the bishop
lessons.explanation: Ng5 creates a double attack! The knight attacks the weak f7 pawn, and moving the knight uncovers your bishop's attack on the bishop on c5.

lessons.title: Pawn Fork
lessons.description: Use a pawn to fork two pieces

alternatives.feedback: This attacks the knight but allows it to simply move away
Development is good but you're missing a tactical opportunity

lessons.hint: A simple pawn move can attack two pieces at once
lessons.explanation: d4 forks the bishop on c5 and the pawn on e5, forcing Black to lose material as both pieces cannot be saved.
